revised_title: Investigation of Blood Circulation and Chlorocruorin in Sabellids and Serpulids
tldr: The authors conducted an experimental investigation of blood circulation in sabellids and serpulids, polychaete worms with unique blood systems. They discovered that these worms have a Galenic circulation in their capillaries and that their blood vessels are rhythmically contractile. The study provides insights into the anatomy and physiology of these worms and their respiratory and circulatory systems.
